title: [Self-directed] Entrepreneurship Education Design Through Comparative Research

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Economics and Business Administration
context.additional_context: Project-based learning comparing cultural differences and impacts of curriculum structures by analyzing case studies from Indonesian and Malaysian universities

learning_goals: Learners can analyze differences in entrepreneurial education approaches between Indonesia and Malaysia.

Over six months, learners engage in project-based activities (business idea development, market analysis, etc.) and establish and execute improvement plans to achieve at least 15 out of 20 points (4+ per item) on the entrepreneurial attitude rubric (innovation, risk-taking, leadership, etc., 5 items).
Learners can explain the impact of cultural context and educational timing on the formation of entrepreneurial spirit.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
